author: Jordan Pandy
title: Millennial Buys Duplex As First Home, Rental Income Helps Pay Mortgage
text:
Real Estate I bought a duplex as my first home. I still have a mortgage, but I only pay around $900 a month and have no regrets. author: Warren Cole Smith
title: Trump - Religion Unplugged
text:
Evangelicals’ Uneasy History With The Government Trough
(ANALYSIS) Conservatives, Christian conservatives in particular, have always had a troubled and inconsistent relationship with the idea of government funding flowing to nonprofits. Now, Donald Trump has reengaged the fight to reduce the size of government with DOGE, though he is going about it in strange ways.
Read More
topics: Religion and Belief->relations between religion and government

author: Pierre-Yves Paque
title: "On faisait la fête en plein ciel… quand on a vu la fumée par le hublot" : La DH était à bord du vol festif de Tomorrowland au moment de la catastrophe - La DH/Les Sports+
text:
"On faisait la fête en plein ciel… quand on a vu la fumée par le hublot" : La DH était à bord du vol festif de Tomorrowland au moment de la catastrophe
La DH était à bord du party flight Tomorrowland depuis Ibiza direction Bruxelles… quand, juste avant d'atterrir, les festivaliers voyaient la Mainstage partir en fumée depuis leur hublot.
- Publié le 17-07-2025 à 06h35
- Mis à jour le 17-07-2025 à 06h40
"Oh, mon Dieu ! Je suis choquée ! La fumée, là, c'est Tomorrowland ?", lance une festivalière japonaise à bord du vol festif SN1687, venu d'Ibiza, au moment d'atterrir à Bruxelles Airport vers 19 heures ce mercredi soir. Les téléphones sonnent et s'agitent dans tous les sens… la nouvelle tombe : l'incendie est bel et bien la Mainstage de Tomorrowland. Stupéfaction dans l'avion. Idem dans le cockpit. "On a vu la fumée avant d'atterrir, on n'était pas sur puis on nous a informés que c'était bien Tomorrowland qui prenait feu", dixit les pilotes. Même son de cloche de cette festivalière néerlandaise. "On faisait la fête en plein ciel… quand on a vu la fumée depuis le hublot… C'était impressionnant !"

author: May El Masri
title: The Way out of the Economic Crisis: Reviving Lebanon’s Economy: Four Sectors in Focus
text: The Way out of the Economic Crisis Reviving Lebanon’s Economy: Four Sectors in Focus In partnership with The Lebanese Center for Policy Studies (LCPS), The Friedrich Naumann Foundation Lebanon hosted a pivotal conference titled "Reviving Lebanon’s Economy: Four Sectors in Focus" at the Gefinor Rotana Hotel in Beirut, with simultaneous online participation. This event marked a significant step towards addressing the profound challenges faced by Lebanon's economy, particularly in the Knowledge Economy, Manufacturing, Healthcare, and Agriculture sectors. The conference, held on November 28, 2023, was a culmination of over a year of multi-sectoral research by the LCPS team and leading experts. It featured the unveiling of four insightful policy briefs that delved into Lebanon's economic crisis, covering essential sectors and offering a roadmap to resilience and reform. Event Highlights: * In-depth Discussions: The event gathered experts, policymakers, private sector representatives, economists, academics and civil society representatives to engage in timely discussions based on research and recommendations aimed at driving Lebanon towards economic recovery. * Sectors of Focus: The conference spotlighted four key sectors – the Knowledge Economy, Manufacturing, Healthcare, and Agriculture – each representing a pillar crucial for Lebanon's economic revival. * Policy Briefs Presentation: The event featured the presentation of four insightful policy briefs developed by the LCPS team and experts. These briefs are crucial in understanding and addressing the nuances of Lebanon’s economic crisis. Check the difference briefs through the following links; [https://www.freiheit.org/lebanon/lebanons-economic-crisis-sector-reforming-healthcare-system](https://www.freiheit.org/lebanon/lebanons-economic-crisis-sector-reforming-healthcare-system) [https://www.freiheit.org/lebanon/lebanons-economic-crisis-sector-challenges-and-opportunities-manufacturing](https://www.freiheit.org/lebanon/lebanons-economic-crisis-sector-challenges-and-opportunities-manufacturing) [https://www.freiheit.org/lebanon/lebanons-economic-crisis-sector-knowledge-economy-loses-its-balance](https://www.freiheit.org/lebanon/lebanons-economic-crisis-sector-knowledge-economy-loses-its-balance) [https://www.lcps-lebanon.org/articles/details/4801/lebanon%E2%80%99s-economic-crisis-by-sector-agriculture%E2%80%99s-roadmap-to-resilience](https://www.lcps-lebanon.org/articles/details/4801/lebanon%E2%80%99s-economic-crisis-by-sector-agriculture%E2%80%99s-roadmap-to-resilience) * Expert Panels: Renowned speakers and moderators provided their insights and expertise, enhancing the dialogue and offering tangible solutions. The conference successfully initiated a meaningful dialogue and offered practical recommendations to address the economic crisis. It sought to pave the way for recovery and resilience in Lebanon’s troubled economy. The event has set the stage for ongoing collaboration and action among stakeholders to implement the strategies and insights shared. Participants and organizers expressed a strong commitment to continue these efforts, with a focus on advocating the strategies discussed during the conference.
